page.title: 14ORGANISED RECREATION I
page.content: {Apperley Scout Group}held its first meeting in September 1975. At first there were only fourteen people. In 1978 the Cub Scouts began Morris dancing and bell ringing and made their first appearance in the same year. Mr. Cripps was the founder scoutmaster, along with his wife, until recently. Such youth groups find it difficult to find qualified adult supervisors. Dave Fisher organises the transport of{Apperley {Football Club}to and from their matches and is also a qualified referee.{Cricket}matches are held most weekends at Apperley's own cricket pitch. In June 1985 they held the 'Alternative Ashes' at which Bob Willis and Mike Denness,formerly of England, played against an Australian cricket club which took back home the 'Alternative Ashes' Urn.
